result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie A Fields

records.addlTxt: and returned.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/21/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1050 (per case). $750 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Cody F except only as necessary during court proceedings. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 4200 block of Portland Pkwy in Madison. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $750 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Cody F except only as necessary during court proceedings. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 4200 block of Portland Pkwy in Madison. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

02:19 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
